title.value: Milken Institute Addresses the ‘Forces Shaping Asia’ at Third Asia Summit

value:
SINGAPORE – On September 15-16, the Milken Institute will again convene 400 regional and global leaders — including CEOs, major investors, heads of sovereign wealth funds, philanthropists and top officials — at the annual Asia Summit in Singapore. Bringing the ambitious spirit of the Institute’s Global Conference to the Little Red Dot, but on a much more intimate scale, the Summit will address real challenges and propose workable solutions to the “Forces Shaping Asia.” Held at the Four Seasons hotel, the Summit program will focus on eight critical “forces” influencing Asia’s future: security dynamics, economic integration, sustainable development, tech disruption, capital markets reform, philanthropy, aging and the middle class. These interconnected forces present unique opportunities and challenges that require collaborative and innovative approaches involving leaders, originators and actors from diverse sectors and industries.“As this dynamic region grows, so do the issues. It is becoming ever more important that leaders across sectors come together to find common solutions,” said Mike Klowden, CEO of the Institute. “That is the goal of the Asia Summit. The Milken Institute will continue to address pivotal regional issues by convening individuals with the ability and ambition to spark real change.”Speakers include: Raphael Arndt, Chief Investment Officer, Future Fund, Australian GovernmentRonnie Chan, Chairman, Hang Lung Group Ltd.
Jeffrey Jaensubhakij, Deputy Group Chief Investment Officer and President, Public Markets, GIC
P.N.C. Menon, Founder and Chairman Emeritus, Sobha Developers
Ravi Menon, Managing Director, Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)
Michael Milken, Chairman, Milken Institute
Hiromichi Mizuno, Executive Managing Director and Chief Investment Officer, Government Pension Investment Fund, Japan
Indra K. Nooyi, CEO, PepsiCo
Jacqueline Poh, Managing Director, Infocomm Development Authority of Singapore
Serge Pun, Executive Chairman, Serge Pun & Associates
Tokihiko Shimizu, Managing Director and Head of Private Market Investments, Japan Post Bank
Keiko Tashiro, Senior Executive Managing Director and Head of Overseas Operations, Daiwa Securities Group
Mark Tucker, Group CEO and President, AIA Group Ltd.
Chris Wei, Executive Chairman, Aviva Asia and Friends Provident International; Global Chairman, Aviva Digital
Lei Zhang, Founder, Chairman and CEO, Hillhouse Capital Management Group Ltd.
Jaime Augusto Zobel de Ayala, Chairman and CEO, Ayala Corporation
The Asia Summit is an invitation-only event limited to 400 participants who include leaders in international capital markets and decision makers across industries and sectors. Complete information about the Summit, including a full program and list of confirmed speakers, is available at: www.asia-summit.org.Credentialed members of the press wishing to cover the Asia Summit may request an invitation:Ann-Marie Eu+65 6636 2578aeu@milkeninstitute.org
